alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 16 at 11:43AM EST until December 16 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of the Florida Keys, in Monroe County. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. The heavy rainfall may occur during the times of the early morning high tides, which would exacerbate drainage concerns. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong to severe thunderstorms remain possible across the Florida Keys this afternoon and overnight. Rainfall rates could exceed 2 inches per hour within the strongest storms. Rainfall totals over the next 18-hours will range from 2 to 4 inches, with localized amounts around 5 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Statements or Advisories. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys
